meanings.definition: To move or act in a clumsy or awkward manner.
meanings.sent1: She sprattled across the room, tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: The toddler sprattled around the playground, bumping into other children.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, she sprattled through the dance routine, causing laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: His attempts to impress her with his dance moves only resulted in him sprattling around like a newborn foal.
meanings.sent5: The clown sprattled comically on the stage, entertaining the crowd with his antics.

meanings.definition: To scatter or spread in a disorderly way.
meanings.sent1: The wind sprattled the leaves across the yard, creating a messy pile.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally sprattled the papers all over the floor when she bumped into the desk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy sprattled the toys around the room, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The seeds sprattled out of the packet and onto the ground, ready to grow.
meanings.sent5: The artist sprattled paint on the canvas, creating a beautiful, abstract masterpiece.
